result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shaheem K Fields El

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[ae] case called 1:23 PM Defendant Shaheem K Fields El appeared by Zoom.  Attorney Gary Raymond George appeared by Zoom. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
The Court reviews case history.

Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.
Scheduling discussed by parties 

The Court states that Zoom appearances will be allowed for next hearing if it will be a waiver of prelim. 

recess 1:27 pm. 

NEXT: (1) Preliminary Hearing 11/11/22 at 9:00 am
Court's Response to Def. request for zoom appearance: The Court approves zoom appearances at todays hearing; counsel so notified by email with zoom instructions.
Letter to the Court requesting zoom appearance

Adjustment Number: 22A 231608,
Payable Number: 196199,
Receipt Number: 22R 019066,
Amount: $20.00
Adjourned initial appearance on October 26, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Right to Legal Representation in Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[ml] Case called at 1:33PM
Defendant Shaheem K Fields El appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (PD appears for bond-purposes only; Def declined eval). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court tolls preliminary hearing time limits and sets this matter over for an Adjourned Initial Appearance. 

The Court requires a $2,500.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no possession of any dangerous weapon
--not drive without a valid drivers license

recess 1:37PM

NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance (also Status of Counsel) on 10/26 at 1:15PM
